name: 2-hydroxy-3-methoxybenzoic acid
Reason: 2-hydroxy-3-methoxybenzoic acid has a melting point that can be predicted by considering the functional groups present in the molecule. The basic unit for comparison is benzoic acid, which has a melting point of 120 degrees Celsius. The methoxy group (-O-CH3) adds approximately +10 degrees Celsius due to increased molecular weight and rigidity. The hydroxyl group (-OH) adds approximately +5 degrees Celsius due to increased molecular weight and hydrogen bonding potential. The carboxylic acid group (-COOH) adds approximately +10 degrees Celsius due to increased molecular weight and hydrogen bonding potential. The methoxy group also increases the molecular weight, which can contribute to the melting point.
